title: Miraflores, Barranco & San Isidro - Districts Tour (Small Group)
description: Complete your Lima bucket list in just half a day on a small-group sightseeing tour. This excursion is ideal for travelers who are short on time, as well as people who want to orient themselves to the city for future exploring. The extensive itinerary includes visits to the Barranco neighborhood, Miraflores, Huaca Pucllana shrine, Olive Park, and more. Along the way, enjoy live commentary that brings Lima’s history and culture to life.
all_descriptions: Complete your Lima bucket list in just half a day on a small-group sightseeing tour. This excursion is ideal for travelers who are short on time, as well as people who want to orient themselves to the city for future exploring. The extensive itinerary includes visits to the Barranco neighborhood, Miraflores, Huaca Pucllana shrine, Olive Park, and more. Along the way, enjoy live commentary that brings Lima’s history and culture to life.

ItineraryThis is a typical itinerary for this productStop At:Miraflores District, Lima PeruAfter picking you up, we will show you the most beautiful sites that Miraflores has. Learn from your guide about the history and development of this emblematic and most visited district of Lima.Duration: 20 minutesStop At:Huaca Pucllana, Calle General Borgono s/n, cuadra 8, Lima 15074 PeruWe visit first this awesome great adobe and clay pyramid that was built between 200 and 700 AD, representing an important ceremonial and administrative center for the "Lima Culture". Here, we will admire this archaeological site from the outside.Duration: 10 minutesStop At:Parque El Olivar de San Isidro, Av. Los Incas Delimited by Paz Soldán, La Republica and C. Ántero Aspíllaga Avenues, Lima 15073 PeruAfter, we go to "The Olive Park" which is a peaceful and relaxing historical area. It is located in San Isidro district, the main feature of which are the ancient preserved olive trees, that date several hundred years. There are also exhibits of old machinery used in the production of olive oil, plenty of greenery, colorful flowers and shrubs and an ornamental pond stocked with fish and terrapins. Lots of benches and the outside of park lined by beautiful old houses.Duration: 20 minutesStop At:El Parque del Amor, Malecon Cisneros 18, Lima PeruThen, we visit this beautiful attraction which was inaugurated in 1993 and celebrates "love" in all its forms. At its center, an iconic sculpture - "El Beso" (The Kiss") - by acclaimed Peruvian artist Victor Delfín, depicts lovers embracing in an endless kiss. Around the sculpture, tiled benches inspired in Antoni Gaudí's "Parc Güell", in Barcelona. There are colorful mosaic walls, which make it attractive. Enjoy, from the cliffs of Miraflores, awesome views of Lima and its Pacific Ocean.Duration: 20 minutesStop At:Barranco, Lima PeruAfter that, we will go to The Artsy neighborhood of Lima, where you will enjoy a short walk to know more of this iconic site. Be amazing by the beautiful murals and artsy areas that Barranco has. Here, your guide will tell you its meanings that make Barranco such a colorful and trendy place. Also, make your wish in “the bridge of sighs” and visit its wonderful Plaza.Duration: 50 minutesStop At:Puente de los Suspiros, Lima PeruListen from your guide its fascinating story and get ready to cross "The Bridge of Sighs" making a wish!

Come with us and be part of this unforgettable experience! Book it now! Do not miss it!Duration: 10 minutes

Mariana S
14 contributions

Unforgettable walking tour of Miraflores, Baccanco and San Isidro.

If you are looking for a tour that perfectly blends history, culture, and the vibrant pulse of modern Peruvian life, look no further. Our walking tour through Miraflores, Barranco, and San Isidro with Sandy was an absolute highlight of our trip to Lima.
From the very beginning, Sandy was punctual, meeting us right on time with a bright smile, and her attentiveness was evident throughout the entire day. She constantly checked in to ensure we were comfortable, answered all our questions and adjusted the pace to suit our needs. She didn't just give us dates and facts; she wove together fascinating stories and interesting insights that gave us a genuine understanding of each district's unique character. From the cliffside parks and Huaca Pucllana in Miraflores, to the bohemian soul and colorful streets of Barranco, to the sleek financial heart of San Isidro, Sandy provided context that brought everything to life. She shared cultural nuances, and local recommendations that you simply cannot get from a guidebook. Her kindness and passion for her country were infectious, making the tour feel like we were being shown around by a knowledgeable friend.
We ended the tour not only with beautiful photos but with a much deeper appreciation for Lima and its people. This is a must-do for any visitor to Lima!
Written September 19, 2025
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
Lima Highlights Tours
Dear customer,

reviews.title: Susan Review
reviews.text: I had the absolute pleasure of joining Susan’s Miraflores, Barranco & San Isidro tour, and it was one of the highlights of my trip to Lima. From the moment we met, Susan’s warmth and professionalism stood out. She has an incredible way of blending history, culture, and local stories that brought each district to life in a way no guidebook ever could.In Miraflores, she gave us fascinating insights into the coastal views and modern vibe of the district, making sure we didn’t just see the landmarks but truly understood their place in Lima’s identity. Barranco was a treat — Susan’s storytelling turned its colorful streets, street art, and bohemian charm into a living canvas. By the time we explored San Isidro, she had seamlessly shifted gears to highlight its elegance, green spaces, and historical importance.What impressed me most was how Susan tailored the experience to our interests, making the tour feel personal and engaging. She was attentive, answered every question with patience and depth, and made sure we experienced both the must-see highlights and hidden gems.Her passion for Lima is contagious, and her knowledge is remarkable. I walked away not only with great photos but also with a real connection to the city and its culture.I can’t recommend Susan’s tour highly enough — whether it’s your first time in Lima or you’ve visited before, she will show you the city in a way you’ll never forget.

reviews.title: visit with partner
reviews.text: I went, to spend the afternoon copn my partner, and we had a good time, good snack, pejerrey sandwich and chicharron with grape juice and melon, what surprised me is that they have dambo chips, super good

reviews.title: Nice and easy!
reviews.text: I would give it 5 stars except I felt it was slower than expected. We could have moved along a little faster and added a couple more sites or spend more time in Barranco than at the beginning. So if you are looking for a slower paced tour, this is the one. They take you to San Isidro which is a beautiful city in Lima and not many tour. The tour guide was great. He spoke perfect English.

reviews.title: Beautiful walk worth taking
reviews.text: Beautiful tour of Miraflores, San Isidro and Barranco districts. Our very loving and attentive Sandy guide explained in many details each of the places we visited.It was a beautiful and unforgettable walk. Both she and the driver were wonderful.

reviews.title: Awesome semi-private tour
reviews.text: So quaint felt more like a walk around town with a close personal friend.I would highly recommend.  They picked up us promptly at the hotel with plenty of communication beforehand.They then drove us by private van to various locations where we walked and explored.  Martin was very informative, friendly and awesome photographer.  You can tell he loves what he does.  He was also very helpful when the ATM ate my card and refused to give it back.Gracias a Martin (guide) and  Mr.  Jimmy (driver) for introducing us into to these beautiful neighborhoods in Lima.

reviews.title: Go for It!
reviews.text: A nice tour covering the most interesting distticts of Lima with a very polite and knowlegeabke guide. Definitely worth it!

reviews.title: Enjoyable way to explore Lima!
reviews.text: This is a lovely way to explore different neighborhoods of Lima.  Enjoyed seeing Love Park, walking through olive groves in San Isidro, and exploring the artist area of Barranco. Our tour guide, Martin, was extremely knowledgeable about the sites we visited as well as other areas of Peru. It was a great tour and a wonderful experience with a small group of travelers.

reviews.title: A quick way to see a little of each neighborhood. Susan's explanations are very satisfactory. Very knowledgeable about
reviews.text: A quick way to see a little of each neighborhood. Susan's explanations are very satisfactory. Very knowledgeable about the history of the city.

reviews.title: Educational and entertaining
reviews.text: This was our first visit to Lima so we knew nothing about the neighborhoods. Our guide, Mitch, was very knowledgeable and his English was excellent and easy to understand. We completely enjoyed the day.
